website_summaries.verdict: A reliable, high-quality tool with good power. LED light placement is an issue, but overall, this provides exactly what users are looking for.
pros: Hex imp offers good power for its size
Stands up to daily use in heavy construction environments
cons: LED light stays on for several seconds after use, frustrating some users

customer_reviews.title: Fake Milwaukee tools! Not happy will return
customer_reviews.text: So I had this driver for a few weeks and finally used it. It has no power at all. I took Milwaukee tool repair center near me and was told that this tool is a fake? What’s going on here? I’ll change this review once I’m taken care of.
customer_reviews.author: Eddy munster

customer_reviews.title: It’s New
customer_reviews.text: After I placed my order for this I read different reviews with both good and bad things. A lot of the bad reviews were mostly due to the item appearing to be used, but I got mine today and it looks pretty new. Plugged a battery on it and it works, so far. The reason for 4 stars and not 5 is because of the packaging. Even though the bag has a label with the product, it was in a brown box, I expected it to be in its original box just like an impact wrench I purchased earlier this year. Will update on durability after some use
customer_reviews.author: NANCY Z.

customer_reviews.title: Beast!
customer_reviews.text: My only regret was not buying this sooner. I take my wheels off more than I probably should and this makes the process so much easier. MASSIVE torque to get the lug bolts off my car and fast to put them back on. It seems to last forever on a charge with the large M18 battery. Milwaukee Tools are the best. You won't be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: AMZN2000

customer_reviews.title: Amazing driver, you want this
customer_reviews.text: I don't know how I ever got along without one of these drivers. I recently built a pool deck and had a friend help me. He used this driver, I used my 18v Hitachi drill. He was screwing boards down about 4x faster than me and I couldn't figure out why, until I used it. I immediately bought one to add to my Milwaukee tool bag and I've been using it non-stop since then. It makes quick work of any screws. It's fairly light in your hand and of course the Milwaukee batteries last forever. If you are thinking about getting a new hex driver, get this one.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: Already the the m12 version of this tool and it lasted 6 years being abused in automotive shops. Mainly use with 1/4" sockets and screw driver bits. I had some extra m18 batteries so I figured why not? Love the extra power this thing has. I will never buy a snap on power tool.
customer_reviews.author: Ricky Simon

customer_reviews.title: Best impact driver for everyday usage!
customer_reviews.text: An excellent impact driver that is small enough to bring around with you. I've seen these used on vehicles at the service garage bays, however this one is more compact and handy for everyday applications. Whether you're driving a tough bolt for a fence installation to removing lug nuts on your vehicle, this does it all. I do however recommend the stronger lithum m18 battery for maximum power.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Adam

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Opened in a Plain Box
customer_reviews.text: The product description doesn't say its refurbished or used, yet it arrived in an open plain box with just the user's manual. The product description also says this is a brushless motor, but the item I received is definitely a brush motor. Lastly, the manufacturer sticker on mine still has an air bubble under it. I'm not stating that this is not an actual Milwaukee tool. Its just not as it is described on this site, and not like the ones I use at work. I'm returning it. I feel like Amazon should do a better job vetting its vendors.
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: Great driver
customer_reviews.text: I haven't had an impact driver before, and boy do I like it. I already had a Milwaukee drill with two batteries, so this one fit right in with it. Much better than a drill for twisting nuts, bolts, or screws as it's easier to regulate how much twist you give it. But if you really want to give it the full power treatment, it's there. Nice driver, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Beagleville

customer_reviews.title: Milwaukee cordless tools.
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one I broke. It’s a fantastic product. I have many of the Milwaukee cordless tools. At least 20. Mainly automotive related. They are all great. The warranty is amazing. I have sent two flash light back both looked like like they were in a war. Both were quickly replaced with new ones. This selller shipped very very quickly. I was very happy.
customer_reviews.author: James Smith’s

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: love this impact. Its smaller than a drill and makes driving screws much easier
customer_reviews.author: Stephenb123

customer_reviews.title: Good for one month of use
customer_reviews.text: The drill worked great until today, I pulled the trigger and it sounded as if the battery was dead. So I checked the battery.. 3/4 full. It began to work intermittently. I am wondering if the seller is unloading factory defects. By the way, the return window ended 3 days ago.
customer_reviews.author: Charles P

customer_reviews.title: power!
customer_reviews.text: I love this tool. I have used standard cordless drills in the past for all my homeowner type needs. This Milwaukee is so much more powerful then a cordless drill. I use it for almost everything now.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: The best long life battery
customer_reviews.text: The batterys last a long time a fresh charge and i use it all day on a single charge but i am using the 12.0 ah batrery, but over all this screw gun is the bomb i think millwalkie is the best in its class going right now.
customer_reviews.author: Justme

customer_reviews.title: It is a good electrical impact tool for light to medium assembly and disassembly projects
customer_reviews.text: It is very useful for most projects that require either assembly or disability. It isn't intended to be used to remove lug nuts from a car or truck as it doesn't have enough torque for that kind of use
customer_reviews.author: Jack Page

customer_reviews.title: Is it a refurbished or new ?
customer_reviews.text: Just like others came in a bag no warranty card NOTHING but seems to work ok is this a refurbished don't know but for 50 bucks if it is a real Milwaukee great deal lots of power any beat the deal if it's new but guess never know if it's new 5 star all the way
customer_reviews.author: albert marshall

customer_reviews.title: It's a beast
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned an impact driver before, but thought I'd give one a shot to take some screws out of a carpet tack strip that was fastened into a concrete floor...after fighting with my standard power drill for a while, I tried this thing and after about 5 knocks the screw backed out. I'm using this thing everywhere I can now.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Lebowski

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: I'm eletrical lineman and can say this does work great on energized lines. I wont try it on 19.9/34.5 but works great on 7200. Soon as I tried it several other guys on my job ordered them and everyone's working great. Excellent deal would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Randolph

customer_reviews.title: Check the product as soon as it comes in.  Do not just wrap it!!
customer_reviews.text: I bought for my father in law and he didn’t open it up for several months. The button that puts it in forward or reverse will not work. They will not return it after a month. Hope it can be resolved 👎🏻
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly Recommended, Worth the money!!
customer_reviews.text: Just perfect for just about all kinds of jobs, I bought the bigger output battery For more power and longer run time, this is not made for removing car lug nuts or anything that’s really torqued down, but everything else it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas

customer_reviews.title: Once you have the batteries, this is the way ...
customer_reviews.text: Once you have the batteries, this is the way to buy replacements. My prior unit developed a problem with the chuck not wanting to release a bit. The Milwaukee units have a lot more torque than my Bosch ones. Sometimes, you don't want so much.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph N. Scudder

customer_reviews.title: Internal Fan broke after 2 uses!
customer_reviews.text: I used this to replace some rotting deck boards and on the second day of use the internal cooling fan broke apart and the fan baffles were falling out of the vents. I was able to finish the day's work but the impact gun started to smell like it was over heating towards the end and would have likely burned out. Returned and bought a brushless one.
customer_reviews.author: Emily Ritell

customer_reviews.title: Great starter 1/4” impact
customer_reviews.text: Great starter 1/4” impact. Light, but heavy duty. Not the strongest in the line-up but great for small auto repairs.
customer_reviews.author: L.Alfo

customer_reviews.title: Just not my week!!!
customer_reviews.text: Directional switch is floppy in it housing and not up to Milwaukee standers. My original impact by Milwaukee (exact model) broke down at work and sent off to Milwaukee for repairs (2-3 weeks for a repair). Bought brand new one cause needed for work Monday. No impact for this Electrician Monday, ugh

customer_reviews.title: Powerful!
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great driver ,fairly light weight and compact .Very powerful .I like it a lot.!

customer_reviews.text: Not exactly the same as older model. Number I used to order this with .. I wanted to make sure I had same torque power.. but stacked up nicely to my original impact driver .. the original one took grueling punishment for 7 years .. only time will tell the lifespan of this one

customer_reviews.text: What a useful and powerful tool. A must-have to complement your standard drill and hammer drill. After using it for a couple of projects, I wish I would have owned one sooner.

The drill came brand new (although not in Milwaukee packaging). I've only used it once but was impressed with the power for such a small tool. Milwaukee makes great tools and I highly recommend.

product_meta.title: Milwaukee 2656-20 M18 18V 1/4 Inch Lithium Ion Hex Impact Driver with 1,500 Inch Pounds of Torque and LED Lighting Array (Battery Not Included, Power Tool Only)
product_meta.description: For driving heavy fasteners like lag bolts or thick screws, you need a powerful impact driver. Milwaukee provides the power you need with a simple, compact design that will consistently outperform the competition. The 2656-20 impact driver has the necessary features that make a successful power tool. A powerful motor, controlled by a variable speed trigger, creates up to 3,450 impacts per minute, more than enough for a wide variety of jobsite tasks. The LED lighting and textured handle help you work in slippery and dark conditions without a problem, giving you precise control over an evenly-lit work surface. The electronic components in the power tool communicate with the M18 batteries that power it, reducing the risk of overheating or otherwise burning itself out from overuse. Combine that with its compact size and ambidextrous belt clip, and you’re looking at a tool that you can bring to most jobsites and find some utility from. No matter the job, a Milwaukee by your side will make sure it’s done right
feature_bullets: LED LIGHTING: Keep your work illuminated with the LED lighting array located just below the quick-connect chuck
TEXTURED HANDLE: The compact design of this power tool is complemented with the textured rubber grip, which gives you superior handling, even in slippery conditions
VARIABLE SPEED TRIGGER: Apply pressure to the trigger to match the amount of power you need on the job. This can drive the motor to create up to 3,450 impacts per minute
REDLINK TECHNOLOGY: Electronics inside the impact driver communicate with the M18 batteries that power it to reduce the risk of overheating, which results in more efficient work

M18 COMPATIBLE: This cordless Milwaukee impact driver works with the M18 family of lithium ion batteries. Compatible models include the 48-11-1860, 48-11-1850, 48-11-1828, and 48-11-1815, 48-11-1840, 48-11-1820

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
